required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Health-related Quality of Life in Patients on Anticoagulants
clinical_study.official_title: Non-Interventional, Cross-sectional Study to Describe Health-related Quality of Life Among Controlled and Uncontrolled Patients With Nonvalvular Atrial Fibrillation on Anticoagulants. RE-QUOL Study.

brief_summary.textblock: The present study has been designed to describe the health-related quality of life in patients with non valvular atrial fibrillation who have been prescribed a specific anticoagulant treatment for their non valvular atrial fibrilation at least 6 months prior to study initiation. It will be conducted in Departments of Internal Medicine from approximately 50 centers in Spain. It consists of an only visit that will coincide with one of those performed by the patients as part of routine follow-up of their disease. 500 patients seen in internal medicine are planned to be included in the study

primary_outcome.measure: Health Related Quality of Life (QoL) (HRQoL) Scores in the Spanish Adaptation of the Sawicki Questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
primary_outcome.description: Sawicki questionnaire includes 32 items grouped in 5 dimensions: 1) general treatment satisfaction, 2) self-efficacy, 3) strained social network, 4) daily hassles and 5) distress. Patients estimated the impact of each item on their self-perceived treatment-related QoL on a scale of 1 (total disagreement) to 6 (total agreement). Response options for each question were: 1=not at all, 2=very little, 3=a little, 4=somewhat, 5=a lot, 6=very much. High scores in general treatment satisfaction and self-efficacy dimensions indicate high perceived HRQoL. Low scores in the strained social network, daily hassles and distress dimensions indicate high perceived HRQoL. The summary score for each dimension was calculated by dividing the total score of the sum of the items that comprise each dimension into the number of items included in that dimension. For the general treatment satisfaction dimension, the scores of individual questions have to be inverted first to calculate the dimension score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Demographic Data of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Age group, work status and life status of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Height of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Height of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Weight of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Weight of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Body Mass Index (BMI) of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: BMI of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Kidney Function (Creatinine Clearance) of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Kidney function of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients measured by creatinine clearance is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: History of Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) - Time Since Diagnosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of data regarding the specific NVAF profile of uncontrolled patients indicated that the average (± SD) time since diagnosis (calculated as the time from the date of diagnosis to the date of the baseline visit).

secondary_outcome.measure: History of Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) - Age at Diagnosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Age at diagnosis of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) Depression of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) depression (% of LVEF depression) of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients is presented qualitatively.

secondary_outcome.measure: CHA2DS2-VASc Score of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: CHA2DS2-VASc stroke risk score is calculated based on the following conditions: Congestive heart failure, Hypertension, Age (≥ 75), Diabetes Mellitus, Stroke/ Transient Ischaemic Attack (TIA), Vascular disease, Age 65-74, Sex category. CHA2DS2-VASc stroke risk score may range from 0 to 9 with 0 being the best outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: HAS-BLED Score of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: HAS-BLED bleeding risk score is calculated based on the following conditions: Hypertension, Abnormal renal and liver function, Stroke, Bleeding history or predisposition, Labile International Normalized Ratio (INR), Elderly (>65 years), Drugs and Alcohol. HAS-BLED bleeding risk score may range from 0 to 9 with 0 being the best outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients With History of Thromboembolic Events by Categories
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients with history of thromboembolic events by categories are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients With History of Haemorrhagic Events by Categories
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients with history of haemorrhagic events by categories are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Visits to the Physician of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Number of visits to the internal medicine specialist per year of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Therapeutic Time in Range (TTR%) of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Therapeutic time in range (TTR%) of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients determined by the Rosendaal method (poor control < 65%) or by the direct method (poor control < 60%).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time Since Treatment Initiation of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Time since treatment initiation of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients was calculated as the time from the start date of treatment to the date of the baseline visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients Received Type of VKA Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients received type VKA treatment is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Percentage of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients With Concomitant Diseases
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients with at least one other concomitant diseases recorded in the medical history.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Percentage of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients With Active Concomitant Diseases on Visit Day
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients with active concomitant diseases on visit day. The percentage was calculated on total patients who presented each of the diseases.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Percentage of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients With Concomitant Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients with concomitant treatment is presented.

study_pop.textblock: Patients diagnosed of non valvular atrial fibrillation and prescribed DOACs or VKA, who are seen in internal medicine from hospitals of 3 Autonomous Communities in Spain (Madrid, Comunidad Valenciana, Andalucía)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patient is willing and provides written informed consent to participate in this study.
- The patient is at least 18 years of age
- The patient has a diagnosis of non-valvular atrial fibrillation
- The patient is on the same anticoagulant therapy (VKA or DOAC) during at least 6 months and maximum 2 years.
- If treated with VKA, availability of % Time in Therapeutic Range (TTR) in past analytical records or enough amount of International Normalized Ratio (INR) measures to calculate it.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current participation in any clinical trial of a drug or device
- Contraindication to the use of DOAC or VKA as described in the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC).

facility.name: Hospital Público Virgen de los Lirios
Hospital Universitario San Juan de Alicante
Hospital Universitario Virgen de las Nieves
Hospital De Llíria (depende del Arnau de Vilanova)
Complejo Hospitalario de Especialidades Virgen de la Victoria
Consorcio Hospital General Universitario de Valencia

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was an observational, multicentre and cross-sectional study conducted in Departments of Internal Medicine from 47 sites in Spain. The patient received the same anticoagulant treatment for at least 6 months and no more than 2 years.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Data were obtained from a single visit that coincided with one of those performed by the patients as part of routine follow-up of their disease, without interfering with usual clinical practice of the investigator. 535 patients were enrolled and 34 excluded from analysis due to being screening failure and not meeting inclusion/ exclusion criteria.

group.title: Total Patients With Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation
group.description: Patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) receiving conventional vitamin K antagonist (VKA) treatment with uncontrolled anticoagulation status and VKA or direct oral anticoagulant (DOAC) treatment with controlled anticoagulation status were included. For both the groups treatment were given for at least 6 months and up to 2 years.

baseline.population: All patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF), who received conventional vitamin K antagonist (VKA) with uncontrolled anticoagulation status and those with controlled anticoagulation status receiving VKA or direct oral anticoagulant (DOAC) treatment at least 6 months and up to 2 years were included.

group.title: Uncontrolled Group
group.description: Patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) receiving conventional vitamin K antagonist (VKA) treatment for at least 6 months and up to 2 years with uncontrolled anticoagulation status were included in this group.

group.title: Controlled Group
group.description: Patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF), who received conventional vitamin K antagonist (VKA) or direct oral anticoagulant (DOAC) treatment for at least 6 months and up to 2 years with controlled anticoagulation status, were included in this group.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Ethnicity (NIH/OMB)
measure.population: Ethnicity was not reported for this trial.

measure.title: Race (NIH/OMB)

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Health Related Quality of Life (QoL) (HRQoL) Scores in the Spanish Adaptation of the Sawicki Questionnaire
outcome.description: Sawicki questionnaire includes 32 items grouped in 5 dimensions: 1) general treatment satisfaction, 2) self-efficacy, 3) strained social network, 4) daily hassles and 5) distress. Patients estimated the impact of each item on their self-perceived treatment-related QoL on a scale of 1 (total disagreement) to 6 (total agreement). Response options for each question were: 1=not at all, 2=very little, 3=a little, 4=somewhat, 5=a lot, 6=very much. High scores in general treatment satisfaction and self-efficacy dimensions indicate high perceived HRQoL. Low scores in the strained social network, daily hassles and distress dimensions indicate high perceived HRQoL. The summary score for each dimension was calculated by dividing the total score of the sum of the items that comprise each dimension into the number of items included in that dimension. For the general treatment satisfaction dimension, the scores of individual questions have to be inverted first to calculate the dimension score.
outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
outcome.population: All patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF), who received conventional vitamin K antagonist (VKA) with uncontrolled anticoagulation status and those with controlled anticoagulation status receiving VKA or direct oral anticoagulant (DOAC) treatment at least 6 months and up to 2 years were included.

group.title: Controlled Group
group.description: Patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF), who received conventional vitamin K antagonist (VKA) or direct oral anticoagulant (DOAC) treatment for at least 6 months and up to 2 years with controlled anticoagulation status, were included in this group.

group.title: Uncontrolled Group
group.description: Patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) receiving conventional vitamin K antagonist (VKA) treatment for at least 6 months and up to 2 years with uncontrolled anticoagulation status were included in this group.

measure.population: All patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF), who received conventional vitamin K antagonist (VKA) treatment at least 6 months and up to 2 years with uncontrolled anticoagulation status were included.

outcome.title: Percentage of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients With History of Haemorrhagic Events by Categories
outcome.description: Percentage of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients with history of haemorrhagic events by categories are presented.
outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
outcome.population: All patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF), who received conventional vitamin K antagonist (VKA) treatment at least 6 months and up to 2 years with uncontrolled anticoagulation status were included.

outcome.title: Therapeutic Time in Range (TTR%) of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients
outcome.description: Therapeutic time in range (TTR%) of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients determined by the Rosendaal method (poor control < 65%) or by the direct method (poor control < 60%).
outcome.time_frame: The study consisted of a single visit between April 2017 and January 2018
outcome.population: All patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF), who received conventional vitamin K antagonist (VKA) treatment at least 6 months and up to 2 years with uncontrolled anticoagulation status were included.

outcome.title: Time Since Treatment Initiation of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients
outcome.description: Time since treatment initiation of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients was calculated as the time from the start date of treatment to the date of the baseline visit.

outcome.title: The Percentage of Uncontrolled Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) Patients With Active Concomitant Diseases on Visit Day
outcome.description: The percentage of uncontrolled non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) patients with active concomitant diseases on visit day. The percentage was calculated on total patients who presented each of the diseases.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events collected during the study period between April 2017 and January 2018; up to 41 weeks

group.title: Uncontrolled Group
group.description: Patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) receiving conventional vitamin K antagonist (VKA) treatment for at least 6 months and up to 2 years with uncontrolled anticoagulation status were included in this group.

group.title: VKA Controlled Group
group.description: Patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF), who received conventional vitamin K antagonist (VKA) treatment for at least 6 months and up to 2 years with controlled anticoagulation status, were included in this group.

group.title: DOAC Controlled Group
group.description: Patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF), who received direct oral anticoagulant (DOAC) treatment for at least 6 months and up to 2 years with controlled anticoagulation status, were included in this group.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) acknowledges that investigators have the right to publish the study results. Investigators shall provide BI with a copy of any publication or presentation for review prior to any submission. Such review will be done with regard to proprietary information, information related to patentable inventions, medical, scientific, and statistical accuracy within 60 days. BI may request a delay of the publication in order to protect BI’s intellectual property rights.
